pros: They will really make you feel as part of their family. Everything is smooth from the start of my application . Will forever be thankful for this company.
cons: I cannot think of any negative feedback

review_title: Great benefits, job not so good
job_title: Food Nutrition Associate in Tavares, FL
pros: Very good health insurance and PTO was pretty decent. You accumulate hours quickly. They have employee appreciation days. And in this department you get to eat for free which is really nice.
cons: Job position is unorganized and outdated. You write patient orders using paper checks when in other locations they already use tablets. Super time consuming to write out each and every assigned patients information about 3 or 4 times everyday! And we're talking about 30+ patients assigned to you. No time for breaks because you are constantly running back and forth between taking trays to rooms, picking them up, calling or visiting patients all on different floors. Definitely overwork their employees. And on top of that you need to clock in earlier to have enough time to recheck patients, because some get discharged and at end of day if you are not caught up with your work you are leaving way after your "clock out time" and no one cares to help.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tavares, FL
pros: Good work life balance on working 3 days a week, 12 hour shifts
cons: Bad patient to nurse ratio.

review_title: AH Waterman has a Great Culture!
pros: This facility is an amazing place to work. Recently a Spiritual Rejuvenation Experience was set up for all team members to spend time in reflection on the Holy Week and reconnect with the spirituality that may of us have lost through not being able to attend church services as we once did. This speaks volumes about the hospitals mission and makes it a very special place to work. It is just one way they have shown us they care for us employees like family.
cons: I cannot think of any cons, I am grateful.

review_title: Waterman Is The Place To Be

I love being able to pray for and with our patients. I am thankful for staff who will allow me to pray with and for them. They have returned this kindness several times over the years.
cons: Our patients at this time are only allowed one visitor per day. This has been hard on them and we have tried our best to connect with each patient and their loved ones Via the phone or through skype.

review_title: I love my full time job.

review_title: FHW is a family friendly work place.
job_title: Materials Management Buyer in Tavares, FL
pros: The best reasons to work for FHW is that they are family oriented.  They have a great Child Care w/ loving and caring teachers.  While I worked at FHW, I had two pregnancies.  Both of my kids attended the daycare since their 7th week.  It was so much easier and guilt free to go back to work knowing that my kids were a couple of minutes away from me w/ VERY caring individuals.  Each teacher became part of our family and it was very sad to leave.  My family and I still keep in touch w/ the center.  We loved being part of Nancy's family (Director).
cons: A downside of working at FHW is being part of a small community.  Lots of "office" gossip that affects leadership decisions.  If you come from a larger city, you will struggle with the small town mentality that most of the "older" staff has.  Even though most people are professinal, you feel like an outsider since you did not grow up with most of the staff.  I worked at FHW for over 5 years and I always felt like an outsider especially since I moved from the north east.  Be ready for a culture shock if you are coming from a large city.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Tavares, FL
pros:
Nice patients
Beautiful hospital
Great cafeteria food
cons:
Harassment by management 
Night CLs are awful and need to retire
Short staffed
A lot of unnecessary work 
Upper management is horrible
Hospital has little diversity

pros: Co-workers are very friendly and try hard to do their homework well and more. At Advent health waterman hospital we have PDOs.
cons: the hourly payment is very low, they do not give the true value that deserves who is sanitizing everything in that hospital and exposing himself to any virus or bacteria. Really 10 or 10.41 per hour is nothing, for all the work you have to do and under pressure.

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Tavares, FL
pros:
1.) Coworkers care about your well being. 
2.) Benefits: Extensive network of providers and facilities.
3.) Every meeting begins with prayer.
4.) Flexibility: the AHS system is so big you can easily transition from facility to facility without losing tenure perks.
cons:
1.) No well enforced call out policy, so habitually late people are rarely disciplined.
2.) Raises and bonuses are equal across the board so high and low performers receive the same. No extrinsic motivation to do better.
3.) Five year no ladder 401(k) vesting program...not very competitive in this market.
4.) Cafeteria is not open for night shift.

pros:
Florida Hospital Waterman is truly committed to providing excellent care to all in our community.  I have worked here a long time.  It's not easy and it's not perfect, but it is fulfilling to work together with such a talented team to care for our own families and neighbors in their most difficult times.  I believe our staff comes to work every day committed to work hard and do their best.  The leadership team is motivated to listen, learn, and act to bring continual improvement.  It's a journey, not a destination.  I usually go home exhausted, but I come to work each day knowing I will be able to make a difference in the lives of my patients and colleagues.  

My family passes other hospitals to come here for care, and not just because I work here.  It's their hospital of choice.  It makes me feel so proud to hear my parents' compliments about the doctors, nurses, techs, and others -- and they don't sugar-coat their opinions.  Even better, I know that my parents are getting great care.  I trust the people I work with.  

I know this sounds like a commercial, but it's really how I feel.  And I want people who believe that caring for others is an honor and a privilege, people who are committed to the relentless pursuit of excellence, to join our team and help us grow.  If that's you, come check us out.
cons: Healthcare is difficult.  It's just hard to do it well.  Human beings meeting each patient's individualized needs with evidence-based best practices in an ever-changing regulatory environment -- oh, and don't wreck the budget while you're at it -- seems impossible if you think about it too much.  We're not perfect, but we won't stop trying to do better.

pros: Good pay,  New updated equipment to work with.  Always have supplies needed to do a good job.
cons: You accumulate PDO.  When taking off for vacations, holidays or sick days it all comes out of PDO.  A new employee just starting will accumulate a little less than 8 hours a month.  Unless you work all the holidays, 40 hours of PDO is used on holidays.  That leaves a little over 40 hours to cover sick time and vacation  for the first 3 years before your PDO hours is upped to almost 10 hours a month.

review_title: Could be a great place to work, but benefits and management policies are negatives.
job_title: Front Line Health Care Provider in Tavares, FL
pros: The Hospital has a beautiful campus on a hilltop overlooking Lake Eustis.  The grounds and building interior are carefully maintained.  All hospital rooms are private rooms, something patients LOVE.  Large public spaces give this hospital a very open feel.  Large Homecare organization has adequate resources.
cons:
Salaries are below average for the Orlando area.  The most capable people will not work here because they can earn more in other places.

Benefits at this Hospital have always been marginal, but became even worse about a year ago.  Many employees and families can no longer afford to pay the mandatory premiums AND the high co-pays in the Hospital's new health plan.

Likewise, educational benefits are very limited, and poorly administered.  Employees receive  the impression that the Hospital does not want them to further their educations.  HR processes education reimbursements slowly, and make education applications overly complicated and difficult.

Homecare management has done a poor job of making new hires, and seems to promote "yes people" in lieu of finding capable and well-educated managers.  The negative atmosphere in the Homecare offices comes directly from the director of the division who seems to be more interested in playing psych games than she is in leading a high quality organization.

review_title: The best example of TEAMWORK that I've ever experienced!!
job_title: Patient Care Tech in Tavares, FL
pros: I work with an incredible TEAM of dedicated people who genuinely care about others and the environment in which we work.
cons: Can be extremely high stress and overly demanding at times.  For the amount of dedication that all put forth, the pay is a bit too low.

job_title: Patient Care Tech in Tavares, FL
pros: Waterman is a great place to work. The leadership team cares for the staff, it may not be all butterflies all the time because of how busy it gets but at the same time we work together and push through these hard times , I have nothing bad to say about where I work as I love it here. Every organization have faults but we all do have an opportunity to let our voices be heard and our opinion does count. They all may not be worked on the same time as we have hundreds of employees. Waterman does everything to make this a great work environment for staff and patients alike. I have been here for 2 years now and absolutely love my job. There are also opportunity for improvement you just have to keep checking the job board if you want a transfer. People tend to complain that their are no opportunities for moving up but do you check? Or are you not sure and just assume? Waterman has come along way since 2 years and what I have heard from the outside. We are a family and instead of looking at all the bad things within the family and pointing them out Why not let us be positive, work together to build our home/hospital and make it a better place to work and care for our pts. Our pts depend on us to provide the best care possible and that is why they come to us for care. It us continue to work together and instead of looking at all the negative consider working on being more positive and let us continue to build our relationships with staff and patients together.PS our CEO rocks!
cons: I have nothing bad to say as we have come along way in the last couple years and we are still improving. Pts are now choosing us more for care and our satisfaction scores are looking up.

job_title: Nurse Tech II in Tavares, FL
pros: Pay Rate. Benefits.  Learning Experience. And, the  on-site Gym.
cons: Turn over rate with all staff including upper management. Policies and procedures always changing

pros: One of the main reasons I’m so happy to be here at Waterman is through all of this COVID outbreak, I am receiving my full check even though my department has fewer hours due to what is going on. Also, my management team has been very supportive in promoting me to a new area of surgery, even though I hadn’t reached my 90 day period. What AdventHealth stands for, they show in actions on how they are treating us as a whole.

This department should have one hr coordinator and one personal assistant to help it run more smoothly.
